results.title: Wind
results.brief_description: A child’s first discovery of wind - the silent, invisible something that tickles his fancy, ruffles his hair, ripples the grass around him - is portrayed here in winsome animated drawings, utilising sound but no verbal communication.

results.title: Wind
results.brief_description: Shows kite-flying, sailboats, pinwheels and swaying branches to illustrate the power of the wind and introduce the words wind, tree, sea, blow, boat, spin, fly and kite.

results.title: Winchester
results.brief_description: Describes Winchester, one of the great historical cities of England. Shows the 13th century West Gate; Winchester College founded in 1382; Wolvesey Palace (now a ruin) dating back to 1138; Winchester Cathedral (started in 1079, completed in 1486). It was also Winchester where King Alfred held court and Jane Austen lived.

results.title: Win, lose or draw
results.creator_credit: Graeme MacLeod, Heather Williams, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Excalibur Nominees
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
The staging of the Americas Cup in Fremantle had a huge impact on the redevelopment of Perth’s old seaport. Heritage buildings were restored, some lovingly, some superficially and new tourist and shopping precincts were created. This program explores the short and long-term effects of the development on the people of Fremantle, both rich and poor, businessmen and tenants and should give valuable lessons to others planning major redevelopment around a once-off major event such as the Americas Cup.

results.title: Willy Wonka and the chocolate factory [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mel Stuart, David L. Wolper, Stan Margulies, Quaker Oats Company and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description: This funny and inventive screenplay by Roald Dahl is based upon his best-seller “Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.” Gene Wilder is at his zany best as Willy Wonka, owner of a world-famous sweet factory who offers the fabulous prize of a tour of his extraordinary premises to five lucky children. However, when the winners arrive to claim their reward, they are caught up in a series of incredible and exciting adventures as Willy Wonka tests their honesty. The Academy Award nominated soundtrack includes the hit “Candy Man”.

results.title: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
results.brief_description: Eccentric candy man Willy Wonka prompts a worldwide frenzy when he announces that golden tickets hidden inside five of his delicious candy bars will admit their lucky holders into his top-secret confectionary.

constellations_other.name: Perception, time and flickering images
constellations_other.description: Using a peep hole and a loop of rotating still images, mutoscopes control the point of view of the audience while also creating the illusion of depth. Filmmakers have since put optical tricks to work creating surreal scenes.

results.description: Eccentric candy man Willy Wonka prompts a worldwide frenzy when he announces that golden tickets hidden inside five of his delicious candy bars will admit their lucky holders into his top-secret confectionary. But does Wonka have an agenda hidden amid a world of Oompa Loompas and chocolate rivers?
description_for_label: Eccentric candy man Willy Wonka prompts a worldwide frenzy when he announces that golden tickets hidden inside five of his delicious candy bars will admit their lucky holders into his top-secret confectionary. But does Wonka have an agenda hidden amid a world of Oompa Loompas and chocolate rivers?

results.title: Wills and inheritance
results.brief_description: Produced in response to the heavy demand for information on this subject, “Wills and inheritance” examines various aspects of the legal process involved in making wills. Often misunderstood, this important subject effects us all. In documentary style, experts in the field explain topics such as “Why make a will?”, “Contesting and changing wills”, “What happens if you don’t make a will?’, “How to make a valid will”, “The processes of probate”, and “Cultural considerations.”

results.title: Wills and Burke: The Untold Story
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Margot McDonald and Stony Desert
results.brief_description: Comic recreation of explorers Burke & Wills and their ill-fated expedition to cross Australia in 1860. Setting out with 28 camels and 4 camel drivers, they were two-thirds through the journey when the expedition was completely without food and almost out of tea. Public enthusiasm remained high for Burke & Wills and the expedition from which they did not return. Starring Gary McDonald and Kim Gyngell.
